newsitem.title: JAPAN: Argentina mulls 20-25 bln yen samurai bond issue.
newsitem.headline: Argentina mulls 20-25 bln yen samurai bond issue.

text.p: Argentina is considering launching approximately 20 billion to 25 billion yen worth of samurai bonds with a duration of seven to 10 years, underwriting sources said on Tuesday.
"Argentina informed several brokerage houses last Friday that it was intending to issue both Euroyen and samurai bonds," one underwriter said.
It had yet to decide the lead manager, he said.

At that time, Argentina told them it was thinking of issuing about 20 to 25 billion yen worth of seven to 10-year samurai bonds, and 30 to 40 billion yen worth of Eurobonds, with durations of five to 10-years, they said.

They said the samurai bonds might be lead-managed by Nikko Securities, whose subsidiary, Nikko Europe, was also named as lead manager of Euroyen bonds by Argentina. The bonds could be launched after the launch of Euroyen bonds.
